poem:
Title: "When Small Brushes Colour in Grey"

In the hollow of the heart, children draw their fears, 
A deluge of unseen ardor, behind eager ears. 
Numbers swell, a riptide in mental health's sea,
Who will buoy the bobbing hopes, we, or the decree? 
May each small hand reach, in desperate plea,
For a watchful world, not the indifferent key.
